statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description:
Michael Olowokandi had 20 points and 12 rebounds and Elton Brand added 19 and 14 as the Los Angeles Clippers handed the San Antonio Spurs their fourth straight home
defeat, 91-87.
article.headline: Kandi Man proves he can against Spurs' big men

images.name: Brand, Elton 020131 inline
images.caption: Michael Olowokandi, left, and Elton Brand, right, converge on The Admiral.

article.linkText: Clippers end skid after 15 straight losses to Spurs
article.story:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) -- The Los Angeles Clippers have become streak stoppers. Michael Olowokandi had 20 points and 12 rebounds, and Elton Brand added 19 points and 14 rebounds as Los Angeles beat San Antonio 91-87 Thursday night, snapping a 15-game losing streak against the Spurs. Five players scored in double figures for the Clippers. Quentin Richardson scored 18 points, Jeff McInnis 15 and Eric Piatkowski 11. The Clippers halted the Dallas Mavericks' 12-game winning streak on Tuesday. "This is a big win for us," said Brand, who shot 8-for-15 from the field. "We carried a lot of confidence in here after the Dallas game. We knew that this Spurs team is a veteran team, but we stuck with them and pulled it out at the end." Tim Duncan had 23 points and 16 rebounds for the Spurs, who lost their fourth straight home game, their longest home losing streak since April 1997. "It's a very frustrating time," Duncan said. "Of course, you can only think about the moment, and in the moment I can say, yeah, this is the most frustrated time I've been through." Malik Rose added 15 points and 11 rebounds, and Steve Smith and Antonio Daniels each scored 15 points for the Spurs. Trailing 69-65 entering the fourth quarter, the Spurs used a 6-0 run to take a 71-69 lead. The Clippers countered with an 11-4 run later in the period to take an 85-81 lead with 1:50 remaining. Terry Porter made two free throws to cut the Clippers' lead to 89-87. Duncan drove to the basket with 1 second remaining, but his shot was blocked by Darius Miles. "We all knew Tim Duncan was going to make a strong move to the basket and try to get fouled. I took a bit of a gamble leaving Steve Smith, but it was a good gamble by me," said Miles. "That's when I went blindside and wound up getting the block. That was the ball game." McInnis made two free throws with 0.9 seconds left to seal the victory. Daniels hit a 15-foot jumper with 25 seconds left in the second quarter to give the Spurs a 49-47 halftime lead. "Right now, we're looking for some consistency; we're looking to win a game at home," Rose said. "It's frustrating, but all we need to do is win one game to get going." Game notes
San Antonio guard Charles Smith missed the game because of a lower abdominal strain. Smith is averaging 8.8 points and 2.2 rebounds in a reserve role. ... David Robinson returned to the starting lineup after sitting out the Charlotte game with a right quad contusion .. The Clippers are now 5-15 in road games.
